channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Want to visit a castle in Florida? St. Augustine is home to eight
item.description: St. Augustine is commonly known as theNation’s Oldest City. Located between Northeast and East Central Florida, and just a short drive from Jacksonville, this ancient town holds the distinction of being the longest continuously inhabited European-founded city in the continental United States.

item.title: Jack Nicklaus' former caddie on Senior PGA Tour now heads South Florida PGA
item.description: Eric Veilleux knows the game of golf is changing faster thanBryson DeChambeau’s downswing. This point was hammered home last month when Veilleux officially became the 24thpresident of the South Florida PGA during its annual meeting.

item.description: Will a$2 Powerball ticket make you a multimillionaire? As they say in the lottery business, “it could happen to you.”

item.title: School grades: more than just a letter, they're a…
item.description: The release of the Florida Department of Education's annual school grades is more than just an academic exercise; it's a vital public service that empowers our communities in Sarasota and Manatee counties. While the numbers might seem dry, these grades offer a crucial snapshot of our schools' health, fostering transparency, accountability and ultimately, improvement.

item.title: What does the 'One Big Beautiful Bill' mean for Florida…
item.description: How will the 'One Big Beautiful Bill' – a sweeping package of tax and other economic reforms – influence the state of residential housing across the country and in the Sunshine State?

item.title: I'm a Gold Star dad. Obama, Hillary, others must be held accountable.
item.description: The Merriam-Webster Dictionary defines "treason" as "the offense of attempting by overt acts to overthrow the government of the state to which the offender owes allegiance . . . "

item.title: New Venice flood barrier done; work on city fishing pier begins soon
item.description: VENICE – Progress on repairs to high profile areas following damage from hurricanes in 2023 and 2024 continues in Venice, with theglass flood barrier atop the new seawall at Tarpon Center Driveunveiled, whilesupplies are arriving to fix the Venice Municipal Fishing Pier.

item.title: Wetlands in Sarasota, Manatee among those lost in Southwest Florida
item.description: It should come as no surprise that a huge swath ofour wetlands have vanishedfrom Southwest Florida in the last two decades.
